meanings.definition: The act of arranging or placing in a particular order or position.
meanings.sent1: Her disposure of the books on the shelf was neat and organized.
meanings.sent2: The disposure of the chairs in the room made it look welcoming.
meanings.sent3: His disposure of the toys in the playroom led to a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The disposure of the chess pieces on the board signaled the start of a strategic game.
meanings.sent5: The disposure of the flowers in the vase created a beautiful centerpiece.

meanings.definition: The state of being disposed or inclined towards something.
meanings.sent1: Her disposure towards helping others is truly admirable.
meanings.sent2: His disposure towards learning new things is evident in his curiosity.
meanings.sent3: The cat's disposure towards napping all day makes it the laziest pet.
meanings.sent4: The disposure of the audience towards the speaker's message was positive.
meanings.sent5: The disposure of the students towards the upcoming exam varied from nervous to confident.

meanings.definition: The act of getting rid of or disposing of something.
meanings.sent1: The disposure of old furniture was necessary before moving to a new house.
meanings.sent2: Her disposure of expired food from the pantry helped keep it organized.
meanings.sent3: The disposure of the broken toys made space for new ones.
meanings.sent4: The disposure of the evidence was crucial for solving the case.
meanings.sent5: The disposure of the worn-out clothes cleared up space in the closet.
